content: A Prayer in Deep Distress
And you who deal treacherously, though they have not dealt treacherously with you!
When you cease plundering,
You will be plundered;
When you make an end of dealing treacherously,
They will deal treacherously with you.
Impending Judgment on Zion
“Now I will rise,” says the ;
“Now I will be exalted,
Now I will lift Myself up.
You shall conceive chaff,
You shall bring forth stubble;
Your breath,  fire, shall devour you.
And the people shall be  the burnings of lime;
thorns cut up they shall be burned in the fire.
Hear, you  afar off, what I have done;
And you  near, acknowledge My might.”
The Land of the Majestic King
Your eyes will see the King in His beauty;
They will see the land that is very far off.
Your heart will meditate on terror:
“Where  the scribe?
Where  he who weighs?
Where  he who counts the towers?”
You will not see a fierce people,
A people of obscure speech, beyond perception,
Of a stammering tongue  cannot understand.
